title: Kansas City Current clinch NWSL playoff spot with 8 weeks to spare
description: With Saturday's win, Kansas City matched the 2024 Orlando Pride's record for the fastest team to secure a playoff spot in NWSL history.
content:
The Kansas City Current have clinched their spot in the NWSL postseason, and they didn’t wait until the final whistle of the regular season to book their ticket.

The Current beat the North Carolina Courage 2-0 at CPKC Stadium on Saturday with eight regular-season games remaining. Kansas City is the first team to book its spot in the 2025 NWSL Playoffs, matching the 2024 Orlando Pride’s record for the fastest team to secure a playoff spot in NWSL history.

“Job is not finished,” said midfielder Claire Hutton at the post-match press conference. “We’re excited, but obviously, like I said, the job is not finished. We have a lot to do. I think we have eight games left in the league. We want to finish every single game winning, taking our points, whether we’re at home or away, and we’re here to win a championship. We’re not here just to win the league. We’re not here just to make the playoffs. We’re making a difference this year.”

Under coach Vlatko Andonovski, the Current sit atop the NWSL table for the 14th consecutive week, with 46 points, thanks to a 15-2-1 record through week 18 of the regular season. They are now 15 points ahead of the next closest team. The Kansas City Current have also scored a league-leading 36 goals, eight more than the Washington Spirit and San Diego Wave, while conceding just 10. That’s three fewer than Orlando, the NWSL’s next-best defense.

“We have a rule. We celebrate tonight, we rest tomorrow, and we get ready for the next one,” Andonovski told reporters post-match. “It’s not easy, because it’s just a human nature when, when they get success, to have a little bit of a to get a little bit relaxed. But our group did not set a certain goal of whether it’s catching a playoff, winning a shield, or getting a shot out; our goal is to come out as a group and be the best that we can possibly be in every game we play. And we’ve operated like that for now a year and a half, and we were only focused on being the best that we can be in this game.”

Izzy Rodriguez and Lo’eau LaBonta scored the Current’s two goals Friday night. Rodriguez, the 26-year-old left back, buried a left-footed rocket from distance on the right, curling low into the bottom corner after the corner kick. Ten minutes later, captain LaBonta stepped up and smashed a penalty kick into the top left corner after her teammate Temwa Chawinga was fouled in the box by Kaleigh Kurtz.

Kansas City missed the playoffs in its inaugural 2021 season and again in 2023, but made a breakthrough in 2022, finishing second after falling 2-0 to the Portland Thorns in the final. The 2024 season was historic and highly successful for the Current, marked by a strong regular season, a second-place finish in the NWSL and a playoff run that ended in the semifinals in an overtime loss to the Orlando Pride.

Clinching a playoff berth early doesn’t guarantee silverware, and the expanded eight-team postseason field still leaves room for chaos. Nonetheless, Kansas City’s form ensures it’ll enter October as a favorite.

“We took a tough loss last year, and we carried that with us into this season,” LaBonta said on the field after the match. “We’ve had to work through it, and we’re still working through it. You can see us solving problems in the field in real-time, and that’s a maturity we’ve grown into. I’m really proud of this group.”
summary: The Kansas City Current have secured a spot in the 2025 NWSL playoffs, matching the 2024 Orlando Pride's record for the fastest team to secure a playoff spot in NWSL history. The Current defeated the North Carolina Courage 2-0, marking their 14th consecutive week top of the NWSL table with 46 points. They are currently 15 points ahead of the next-place team. The team has scored a league-leading 36 goals, eight more than the Washington Spirit and San Diego Wave, while conceding just 10. Coach Vlatko Andonovski stated that the team's goal is to win a championship and not just make the playoffs.
shortSummary: The Kansas City Current secured their NWSL playoff spot with a 2-0 win over the North Carolina Courage, surpassing the 2024 Orlando Pride.
